climbs.name: Ursa Minor
climbs.fa: Jay Robinson, Tess Egan and Kye Egan-Robinson, 2018

content.description:
More info available on quickdraw publications website. Here's the pitch info:

P1 5.7, 9 bolts, 30m
P2 5.8, 5 bolts, 15m
P3 5.9, 6 bolts, 15m
P4 5.6, 6 bolts, 15m
P5 5.4, 7 bolts, 30m

from the top of p5, move to the climber's right until you pick up a trail (there is flagging tape) which will take you to P6, which is 10m of a low 5th class that you can probably just hike up--or feel free to clip the 3 bolts.

To get off the summit, hike down following flagging tape. You will end up back at the campground using a different route than your hike in (so don't leave anything at the base of the route).

To get to the base of the route: take hwy 99 until you get to Conroy Forest Road and take a left. Go up the road for a minute until you see an obvious small parking lot on the left and campsites. Park here if possible and hike out the other end of the parking lot 40m (further away from the road you just drove up) until you get to an obvious trail to your right (photo in the quickdraw pubs website). Hike up this trail about 15 minutes through forest and boulder field until you get to the base of Ursa Minor.

every pitch has hangers and the first few also have rap rings (I guess in case you give up early?)
